info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 07 at 7:56AM CDT until June 07 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN GARVIN...SOUTHEASTERN CLEVELAND AND SOUTHWESTERN MCCLAIN COUNTIES... At 754 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles east of Lexington to near Wayne to near Maysville to 4 miles northwest of Antioch, moving southeast at 35 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR LOCATIONS NEAR WAYNE, MAYSVILLE, AND PAOLI. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...The Washington Mesonet Station measured a 82 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Pauls Valley, Purcell, Slaughterville, Lindsay, Lexington, Maysville, Wayne, Washington, Paoli, Rosedale, Antioch, Payne, Whitebead and Erin Springs. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across the area! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
